content.description:
third bolt line climbers right from the ladder on the base ledge.

p1 climb the clear dihedral to a pair of rap anchors (5.6/5.7). skip these anchors and climb over a right facing corner to a belay to climbers right.

p2 climb up from left of the belay to a buttress of a right facing corner. skip the belay again, and climb straight up to the anchor you started at.

from the waterworld trail, follow it down to where it forks. there's a clear sign (same type as the waterworld sign - maroon) at the fork that points to go left for gilligan's island. you will pass voyage wall and quickly reach the gilligan's island sign on a tree. clear rap anchors to right of the tree.
bolts, fixed anchors

The climbing is great fun, with well featured rock and many great holds. Climbing up from the water is an absolute joy, and adds to the sense of adventure. The crux is on the second pitch, when traversing left with somewhat awkward feet and a slight feeling of exposure. For full details, refer to Ruedi's guidebook: Revelstoke Rocks.

Pitch 1 (5.7 15m): traverse right of the belay then up into the right facing corner. Use great holds and features throughout to get to the anchor.

Pitch 2 (5.9 25m): Climb diagonally up and left, following the bolts to the anchor.

Descent: Rap down to the initial ledge to the right of the start of boulevard.Â 



From the base of The Boulevard, on the large ledge, traverse right. Use the bolts on the face for protection while climbing to the right, a belay strongly recommended. Stop at the rap rings before the end of the ledge. Rap down to the ledge below, near the water. Start your below from there, climbing up and to the right into the corner.

10 quickdraws & 3 alpine draws. Bolted anchors with rap rings.
two 60m raps take you down to a base ledge where you can reach a number of well protected sport lines. be careful on second rap to not drop your rope in the water!
